curam.util.persistence
Class PersistenceEvent<E extends Entity<?>>

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.persistence.PersistenceEvent<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the entity for which persistence events are handled.
@Implementable
public abstract class PersistenceEvent<E extends Entity<?>>
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class that Persistence event handlers should implement. Note that Persistence event handlers only need to implement the methods corresponding to the events in which they are interested.

Constructor Detail

PersistenceEvent

public PersistenceEvent()
Method Detail

postCancel

public void postCancel(E e)
                throws AppException,
                       InformationalException
Method called after a cancel is performed on an entity. Specifically, this method is invoked when curam.util.persistence .helper.LogicallyDeletable#cancel() is called for the entity, after the database logical delete operation has been performed.
Note that any AppException exceptions raised by event listeners when this event method is invoked are converted to InformationalException by the event dispatcher infrastructure.

Parameters:
e - The instance of the entity on which the cancel is being performed.
Throws:
AppException - Implementors can raise AppException if an error occurs when handling the event.
InformationalException - Implementors can raise InformationalException if an error occurs when handling the event.

public void postInsert(E e)
                throws AppException,
                       InformationalException
Method called after an insert is performed on an entity. Specifically, this method is invoked when Insertable.insert() is called for the entity, after the database insert operation has been performed.
Note that any AppException exceptions raised by event listeners when this event method is invoked are converted to InformationalException by the event dispatcher infrastructure.

Parameters:
e - The instance of the entity on which the insert is being performed.
Throws:

InformationalException - Implementors can raise InformationalException if an error occurs when handling the event.

postRead

public void postRead(E e)
              throws AppException,
                     InformationalException
Method called after a read is performed for an entity. Specifically, called when an entity is retrieved using the ReaderDAO.get(Object) method, after the entity has been retrieved from the database.

Parameters:
e - The instance of the entity that has been read from the database.
Throws:
AppException - Implementors can raise AppException if an error occurs when handling the event.
InformationalException - Implementors can raise InformationalException if an error occurs when handling the event.

postReadMulti

public void postReadMulti(E e)
                   throws AppException,
                          InformationalException
Method called after a read-multi is performed for an entity or collection of entities. Specifically, called when entities are read from the database using the read or search methods available on the entity's generated adapter. Note that it is called after each entity has been retrieved from the database. The method is invoked once per entity retrieved from the database. For example, if a search operation retrieves six entities, this method will be invoked six times, once per entity retrieved.
A separate method to PersistenceEvent.postRead(Entity) is used for read-multis in order to allow event handlers to distinguish which mechanism was used to retrieve an entity.

Parameters:
e - The instance of the entity that has been read from the database.
Throws:
AppException - Implementors can raise AppException if an error occurs when handling the event.
InformationalException - Implementors can raise InformationalException if an error occurs when handling the event.

postRemove

public void postRemove(E e)
                throws AppException,
                       InformationalException
Method called after a remove is performed on an entity. Specifically, this method is invoked when Removable.remove() is called for the entity, after the database remove operation has been performed.
Note that any InformationalException and AppException exceptions raised by event listeners when this event method is invoked are converted to AppRuntimeException by the dispatcher infrastructure.

Parameters:
e - The instance of the entity on which the remove is being performed.
Throws:
AppException - Implementors can raise AppException if an error occurs when handling the event.
InformationalException - Implementors can raise InformationalException if an error occurs when handling the event.
